meanings.sent1: The bigshot in the company made all the decisions.
meanings.sent2: She became a bigshot in the fashion industry after designing a popular line of clothing.
meanings.sent3: The bigshot at the party kept bragging about his expensive car.
meanings.sent4: The bigshot of the town was like a king, everyone knew and respected him.
meanings.sent5: When the bigshot spoke, everyone listened attentively.

meanings.definition: A person who is successful and powerful in a particular field.
meanings.sent1: The tech bigshot revolutionized the industry with his innovative ideas.
meanings.sent2: She worked hard to become a bigshot in the music world.
meanings.sent3: The bigshot chef's new dish was a hit with customers.
meanings.sent4: In the world of sports, he was considered a bigshot among athletes.
meanings.sent5: The bigshot entrepreneur started his business from scratch and built an empire.

meanings.definition: A person who is arrogant or self-important.
meanings.sent1: The bigshot actor refused to talk to anyone on set.
meanings.sent2: She acted like a bigshot, thinking she was better than everyone else.
meanings.sent3: The bigshot customer demanded special treatment at the store.
meanings.sent4: He strutted around like a bigshot, looking down on others.
meanings.sent5: The bigshot politician believed he was above the law.
